channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN

item.title: Report E-2024010366
item.description:
Report E-2024010366

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-08
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 gallons of acetone (UN1090) released from a 5 gallon pail due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer floor and pallet. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and it was determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (1) 15 gallon DM containing metal pail and product, absorbents, and PPE was left as waste for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024010330
item.description:
Report E-2024010330

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a one-gallon spill of regulated UN1203 "TruFuel50" that was damaged at Terminal NMP. (1) a one-gallon metal can was punctured by a forklift during the unloading process impacting Trailer #315-9777. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. (1) 15-gallon metal drum containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent material, the damaged metal can, and the issued PPE was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.
